meanings.definition: (adjective) deeply divided into lobes or segments that are themselves divided
meanings.sent1: The pinnatifid leaves of the fern had many small sections.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the pinnatifid structure of the plant's leaves.
meanings.sent3: The pinnatifid leaves looked like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were pinnatifid, branching off into different directions.
meanings.sent5: The pinnatifid pattern of the tree's branches was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: (verb) to divide into lobes or segments that are themselves divided
meanings.sent1: She carefully pinnatifid the paper into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to pinnatifid the ingredients for better mixing.
meanings.sent3: He pinnatifid the cake into tiny slices for the party.
meanings.sent4: The artist's mind began to pinnatifid the painting into intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor planned to pinnatifid the marble block into a masterpiece.
